alert.note: Alert for Inland Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 29 at 9:46AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following area, Inland Harris. * WHEN...Until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of showers and thunderstorms are expected to continue throughout the morning and into the late afternoon hours as a cold front slowly moves through Southeast Texas. 2 to 3 inches of rain has already fallen across the northwestern portion of Harris County this morning. This area is coming off of seeing over 5 inches of rain from Tuesday`s storms, so soil moisture has not had a lot of time to recover which brings about the potential for flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means there is a potential for flooding based on current forecasts. You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
